sub_title: Luxury & Fashion - Creative and Media Strategy partner for luxury + lifestyle brands
summary:
Emily Logan is an experienced Communications and Marketing professional with a demonstrated history of working in the luxury, fashion, and creative production industries. Possessing cultivated skills in Communications and Media Strategy, Marketing, Creative & Editorial Strategy, Project Management, Copywriting, and Brand Management, her ways of curating storytelling and creativity transcend traditional marketing and lend a unique approach to added value for stakeholders. Her processes prioritise the utmost strategic objectives whilst never compromising cultivated beauty and power of brand identity.

Emily culminated her Pedagogical Career with a Master's (MSc) in Corporate Communications at NEOMA Business School (Programme Grande École) in Paris, France, which was entirely funded by LVMH during her full-time work/full-time studies (Alternance) programme. Her pedagogical journey began at FIDM in Los Angeles with an AA in Visual Communications / Digital Marketing studies, she then transferred on to receive her Bachelor's Degree focused in Marketing and Strategic Design Management from Parson's Paris, The Paris College of Art. 

Her educational background also notably includes Executive Education formations from HEC Paris in Digital Marketing and Luxury Management (#1 Business School in Europe, #3 in the world according to The Economist). She has also received various certifications and trainings from leading authorities such as Facebook, Google, Cannes Lions, and HubSpot. She has also completed formations in the French language and culture at Sorbonne Université in Paris and has attained a certificate of French at level C1.

Emily is an American with International experience; having worked in the American market (Los Angeles, and trainings in NYC), freelance consulting in the UK (London), as well as in France (Paris) and for various international freelance clients remotely, Emily holds a unique, internationally-influenced perspective and carries a breadth of knowledge of these markets in addition to the major markets that she has also closely worked with (Japan, China / Hong Kong, Italy, Germany, Belgium, The Netherlands, and Korea).

Emily's Master's thesis was focused in the construction of high-impact Communications Campaigns for international luxury brands; how to generate influence in a global scale from creative conception/ production to market implementation. Her Bachelor's thesis was in Marketing and Luxury Branding Strategy (on the emerging niches, particularly “wellness”, within the luxury sector) with an emphasis in the French market.

contributors.headline: Luxury & Fashion - Creative and Media Strategy partner for luxury + lifestyle brands

profile_positions.description:
- Managing Global Key Accounts within the Fashion + Luxury sectors. My clients are: Chanel, LVMH, and Kering and select Private clients (Prada, SMCP, Lanvin, Swatch Group, Uniqlo, Karl Lagerfeld, etc.) - in support of their advertising buys across global markets from RFP to production to post campaign reporting, managing brand Creative Production and Media planning, maintenance of industry knowledge and trend reporting and expertise across media and luxury, client services management, and execution of media campaigns and reporting / insights extraction 
- Working across = US / Canada / EMEA / Nordics / APAC
- Management of New Business accounts within the luxury / lifestyle / design domains
- Management of international media planning across various stakeholders (client + multiple international media agencies) for multi-market activations 
- Creative Production management for campaign assets; managing client's creative strategy and execution
- creative project management for all key accounts projects both global and localized media assets 
- partnership with creative internal and external teams to improve production ways of working to meet brand demands 
- Work cross-functionally with the internal art department, Ad Operations team, and sales teams on a global level as well as external stakeholders including local clients, local agencies, global and regional agency strategists, as well as global client-direct contacts.
- Management of brands' global budgets and activations through global performance tracking and trends analysis within the luxury domain
- Budget management and media planning for clients on group level as well as brand level
- Pro-active partnership with global luxury brands to support their campaigns and brand communications objectives
profile_positions.title: Account Manager, Luxury + Fashion

profile_positions.description:
- Serving on the Dom Pérignon International HQ (Maison) team - creation and global orchestration of the Lady Gaga International Brand Campaign (2021), the Lenny Kravitz (2019) campaign, and the Vintage Blanc 2010 millésime release (2020).
- Management of campaign creative production and project management working daily with creative agency TBWA
- Briefing, Creation, and Development of campaign masters and asset adaptations to key media platforms and orchestration to generate highly targeted brand engagement
- Supports the development and deployment of the International communications and media strategy for the Dom Pérignon global brand in order to align with OKRs for the brand from the Maison level
- Participates in development and management of deployment of media and communications agency briefs and plan construction for international global communications orchestration (within all key markets, and secondary main markets) and International Media Plans and execution, as well as ongoing performance monitoring, campaign reporting (during and post-buy) and optimizations on O/P/E platforms. 
- Working to amplify the objectives of the International PR team: ensuring the carrying out of key campaign messaging in international communications and media plans and throughout content
- Execution of Benchmarking studies in the domain of Luxury for International Maison use
- Project Management / creation of campaign Beautyshot / Limited Edition content for international use - from briefing and conception, to project management, budgeting/cost control, contribution of creative feedback/returns to agency
- International Project Management with key markets (US, UK, IT, JP, and Germany), and partner creative and media agencies (TBWA, KRWM, Dentsu, Publicis, Carat)
- English copywriting for Dom Pérignon content for select International brand use and in PR communications & press kits/releases and for the brand website (domperignon.com)
profile_positions.title: International Junior Communications + Media Manager | Dom Pérignon

profile_positions.description:
- Created a strategy in expansion of the brand's O/P/E Media and reformed business model focus from retail dependency to focusing REV as an Editorial platform with the key strategy being to mitigate operating costs and maximize on our strengths in key activities while opening up new revenue streams. Positioning REV as a leading authoritative brand in the 'honest luxury' fashion, lifestyle, and beauty space.
- Executed Benchmarking Studies and Market Research in supporting the development of the brand strategy.
- Supported development of brand identity and content creation strategy to deliver exceptional creative through the Art Direction team.
- Worked directly with the Social Media and Sales teams as well as PR agency cross-functionally to carry out brand and business model objectives from an omni-channel communications and marketing perspective.
- Managed strategy and execution for paid, earned, and owned media on key online (Podcast, Facebook, Instagram, Website, etc.) and offline platforms as well as outreach with these media outlets.
- Managed Macro and Micro influencer campaigns in support of brand objectives and amplification of key messaging
- Management of the Rêve En Vert Editorial platforms (blog and podcast) strategies, contributing writers, content development, etc.
- Effectively managed strategic tactics geared towards expansion in new markets to Nordic Regions, French, and American key Markets + operational local activations
- Effectively managed back house web development and ensure all content optimization (SEO) as well as SEM (Google Ads) buys
- Managed strategic partnership initiatives with brands such as Soho House, Equinox, Net-a-Porter, etc. (online and offline) + pitching brand and Founder for speaking engagements and Podcasts + influencer programs for the brand
- Marketing Metric management + Data Analysis for internal regular performance reporting / benchmarking
- A&P Budget Management / recommendations
profile_positions.title: Marketing + Communications Manager

profile_positions.description:
Oxford Fashion Studio is a complete show and campaign management agency for niche luxury fashion brands geared towards curating luxury experiences and impactful Public Relations exposure.
- Served on the Public Relations team as a freelance PR / Event assistant for the Production Team and PR Agency (Task PR) Paris Fashion Week SS 2018 (debut Fall 2017). 
- Worked on event operations and production for the show - Event management and execution of Run of Show / operations for the events
- Managed all creative collateral production and PR strategy to generate engagement with press outlets and VIP attendees / influencers
- Organization of Press communication + coverage in support of the productions before, during, and after this PFW cycle.
- Coordinated schedules, SOPs, and managed communication with the intern teams.
profile_positions.title: Public Relations + Event Specialist at Paris Fashion Week

profile_positions.description:
CLIENTS: Heineken, Gucci fragrance, and State Farm Insurance
- Freelance Production Coordinator of Commercial Production team in organizing the communication, business, finance and employment issues in commercial production for various commercial production companies
- Partner with the NYC and London-based Executive Producers and Marketing brand Creative Directors & Production Managers on creative crewing, priorities, scheduling, and volume
- Directly coordinated and managed the project with respective clients and their creative agencies (Gucci, State Farm) 
- Creatively support client needs within facility and exceed brand partner expectations
- Art buying relations: Source external artistic / creative vendors, sound mixing, color correcting, visual effects, etc.
- Completes script and storyboard breakdowns for models, props and background designs. Allocates design work to artists and follows through to completion. Assigns appropriate due dates based on established production schedule.
- Coordinates and tracks the progress of assigned artwork and flags potential problems and delays for the Production Team. 
- Organizes and maintains systems for monitoring production flow of assigned artwork (sets up files, keeps a log of start/complete dates of assignments, labels materials, etc.)
- Coordinates the preparation of pre-production materials for shipping: tracks Director and Producer and approvals.
- Prepared a status report weekly for the pre-production meetings, responsible for project management + call sheet creation and management of the production team and talent coordination
profile_positions.title: Assistant Production Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Marketing, PR, and Events Coordinator for the Los Angeles region of 8 high-profile clubs (Beverly Hills, Santa Monica, West Hollywood, Westwood, DTLA) including serving as key marketing contact for opening and development of Equinox Hollywood, Equinox Miracle Mile, and Equinox Century City.
- Management of Los Angeles Member + Brand Events and luxury partner outreach
- Brand impact and consumer engagement (member experience CRM and new lead-driving)
- Support deployment of brand campaign communications within the Los Angeles region (Equinox Made Me Do It and Commit To Something campaigns)
- Curation of relationships with earned media and partners in the Los Angeles Region geared towards generating reach, engagement and tangible lead generation.
- Luxury and Wellness Communications and industry Trends Benchmarking for Los Angeles to serve as marketing intelligence for the region
- Managing all influencer (macro and micro) campaigns and strategy + content in Los Angeles region
- Post-mortem tracking of KPIs and quarterly audits for organic and paid marketing / event initiatives
- Support of implementation of West Coast regional marketing + consumer communications strategy
- PR + storytelling strategy development: Press Release / Press Kit support and brand copywriting for SoCal Region
- Creative asset development for marketing and PR initiatives and creative project management with in-house creative team as well as the creative agency Wieden + Kennedy for use in paid media, earned media, owned media, as well as support materials for sales/outreach/events
- A&P Budget management / working directly with payroll finance and managing /coordinating compliance and supervision for employees working marketing activities
profile_positions.title: Regional Marketing + PR Coordinator, Los Angeles

profile_positions.description:

- Scheduling and relations for the salon owners' top clients as well as celebrity clientèle and influencers to affirm the salon's luxury, California-chic positioning
- Worked with targeted lifestyle publications for media exposure such as Refinery29, Allure, Haute Living, RackedLA, LA Mag, and Bustle

volunteer_experiences.role: English lessons for Refugees and underprivileged youth in Paris - Intermittent Volunteer

Volunteered as mentor and “Big Sister” for young girls in underprivileged situations in Los Angeles. Duties included tutoring for school, providing advice and advocacy, spending quality time serving as a babysitter, etc.
